description.plain:
Anita Baker is a Grammy Award-winning singer-songwriter known for her distinct low contralto vocals. She started out in the band Chapter 8, which had the hit song “I Just Wanna Be Your Girl” that was later sampled by Bone Thugs-n-Harmony for their hit song “1st of tha Month.” “Anita” went on to become a big name in ‘80s R&B alongside “Luther” and “Whitney” as she began to rack up #1 hits.

Her debut album, The Songstress, was released in 1983 on independent label Beverly Glen and featured the hit song “Angel.” She left Beverly Glen and signed with Elektra Records, releasing her second album Rapture in 1986, which went on to sell over 5 million albums and peaked at #1 on the Billboard R&B Albums chart thanks to the hits “Sweet Love,” “Same Ole Love,” and “Caught Up in the Rapture.”

Her third album, Giving You the Best That I Got, was released in 1988 and hit #1 on the Billboard 200, and the title track hit #1 on both the Billboard R&B and Adult Contemporary Singles charts. Rapture and Giving You the Best That I Got accounted for five of her eight Grammy Awards, with her sixth in that time frame coming from her gospel collaboration with The Winans on the song “Ain’t No Need To Worry” in 1988.

She released Compositions in 1990 and Rhythm of Love in 1994, which both went Platinum, but she decided to take a break from the music industry to focus on her family before returning with My Everything on Blue Note Records in 2004 and releasing a cover of Tyrese’s “Lately” in 2012. Anita embarked on a farewell tour in 2018 to celebrate her decades-long career in the music business.

description.plain:
Sweet Love is the second single from Anita Baker’s sophomore album “Rapture”. It was written by Anita Baker (along with Gary Bias & Louis A. Johnson) & produced by Michael J. Powell.

The song became a hit, peaking at #8 on the Billboard Hot 100, #3 on Billboard’s Adult Contemporary chart & #2 on Billboard’s R&B chart in 1986.

It also won a Grammy Award in 1987 for “Best R&B Song.”

songs.full_title: Giving You The Best That I Got by Anita Baker
songs.title: Giving You The Best That I Got
songs.title_with_featured: Giving You The Best That I Got

description.plain:
Giving You The Best That I Got is the lead single & title song of Anita Baker’s third album.

The song became her highest charting song on the Billboard Hot 100, peaking at #3 on the chart.

It also topped Billboard’s R&B chart for two weeks in November of 1988 and topped Billboard’s Adult Contemporary chart for a week in December of 1988.

“Giving You The Best That I Got” won a Grammy Award for “Best R&B Song” and “Best Female R&B Vocal Performance” in 1989. It was also nominated for “Song of the Year” and “Record of the Year.”

songs.full_title: Angel by Anita Baker
songs.title: Angel

description.plain:
“Angel” peaked at #5 on Billboard’s R&B chart in 1983, being the second single released from Baker’s debut album.

It was written by Anita Baker, Sandra Sully & Patrick Moten (who co-produced the song along with Otis Smith).

Biographer Chris Rizik aligns the response to this song as the catapult for Baker’s career:

a jazzy, mellow cut that became a smash on Black radio and created an immediate buzz for the unheard of singer and record label. It also attracted the attention of Elektra Records, which signed Baker to her first major label deal.

songs.full_title: Good Love by Anita Baker
songs.title: Good Love

description.plain:
Though “Good Love” was never released as a single, it remains a standout from Anita’s second major label album Giving You The Best That I Got. The moody midtempo ballad about a longing for romantic connection was written by Gary Taylor.

The vocalist who originally recorded the demo for Anita to evaluate was then-unknown soul singer Lalah Hathaway. Lalah would launch an impressive solo career with the Gary Taylor-penned “I’m Coming Back,” and come full circle to eventually win a Grammy another Anita Baker classic, “Angel.”

“Good Love” got a huge boost in profile a decade later as hip-hop group A Tribe Called Quest scored a sizable hit with “Stressed Out” featuring Faith Evans resinging new lyrics to the chorus of “Good Love.”

songs.full_title: You Belong To Me by Anita Baker
songs.title: You Belong To Me

description.plain:
“You Belong To Me” is a cover of the Carly Simon and Michael McDonald penned song recorded separately by both artists. Anita modifies the song by re-purposing the song’s pre-chorus as an intro to the song. Baker however faithfully recreates Michael McDonald’s background arrangement with her own similarly textured voice.

This is not to be confused with a different song titled “You Belong To Me” from 1988 album Giving You The Best That I Got.

songs.full_title: You're My Everything by Anita Baker
songs.title: You’re My Everything

description.plain:
“You’re My Everything” is a 2004 song by American recording artist Anita Baker. The song was released as the lead single in support of her hit album, My Everything.

Anita Baker’s single, “You’re My Everything” peaked at number 25 on Billboard’s Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs, Baker’s first top 40 since 1995’s “It’s Been You” from her Rhythm of Love album.

songs.full_title: Soul Inspiration by Anita Baker
songs.title: Soul Inspiration

description.plain:
Soul Inspiration is the second single from Anita Baker’s fourth album “Compositions”.

The song peaked at #72 on the Billboard Hot 100, #11 on Billboard’s Adult Contemporary chart & #16 on Billboard’s R&B chart (staying on the chart for 17 weeks) in 1990.

body.plain: Do You Believe Me is the last track from Anita Baker’s debut album “The Songstress” and the b-side to the single “Angel”.

songs.lyrics:
Do You Believe Me LyricsWhen I say to you that my love is true
Do you believe me?
And when I try to give my love to you
Do you receive me?

When I try to do my best
You put me to the test
Baby, do you deceive me?
So baby, do what you gotta do
And when you do
You're gonna need me

Don't confuse your mind
With what the other people say
You will see in time, baby
That my love is here to stay
They gonna try to come between us, baby
We can't let them in our way
We have got a good thang going
Don't you let it slip away
Don't you let it slip away

Believe in me

Now I can deal with the problems
That the world has put on me
But sometimes it just gets so hard
And I just feel so weak
I really need you, baby, baby
To believe in me

Cause the more you do
The better I'll be
And I promise you I'll never leave
Cause this is where I want to be

Believe in meEmbed

description.plain: “How Does It Feel” is a song by American recording artist Anita Baker. The song was released as a second single from her My Everything album. “How Does It Feel” peaked #41 on Billboard’s R&B/Hip-Hop Singles.

body.plain: “How Does It Feel” is a song by American recording artist Anita Baker. The song was released as a second single from her My Everything album. “How Does It Feel” peaked #41 on Billboard’s R&B/Hip-Hop Singles.

songs.lyrics:

Darling, would you mind if I hold on tight
And love you for the rest of my life?

Darling would you mind if I hold on tight

Honey, how could you love me?
How could you love me like this?
I said I never knew just what I missed
How could you love me like this?

songs.lyrics:
Mad About You - The Final Frontier LyricsA stone's throw from Jerusalem
I walked a lonely mile in the moonlight
And through a million stars were shining
My heart was lost on a distant planet
That whirls around the April moon
Whirling in an arc of sadness
I'm lost without you I'm lost without you
Though all my kingdoms turn to sand
And fall into the sea
I'm mad about you I'm mad about you
And from the dark secluded valleys
I heard the ancient songs of sadness
But every step I thought of you
Every footstep only you
And every star a grain of sand
The leavings of a dried up ocean
Tell me, how much longer? How much longer?
They say a city in the desert lies
The vanity of an ancient king
But the city lies in broken pieces
Where the wind howls and the vultures sing
These are the works of man
This is the sum of our ambition
It would make a prison of my life
If you became another's wife
With every prison blown to dust
My enemies walk free
I'm mad about you I'm mad about you
And I have never in my life
Felt more alone than I do now
Although I claim dominions over all I see
It means nothing to me
There are no vitories
In all our histories, without love
A stone's throw from Jerusalem
I walked a lonely mile in the moonlight
And through a million stars were shining
My heart was lost on a distant planet
That whirls around the April moon
Whirling in an arc of sadness
I'm lost without you I'm lost without you
And though you hold the keys to ruin
Of everything I see
With every prison blown to dust
My enemies walk free
Though all my kingdoms turn to sand
And fall into the sea
I'm mad about you I'm mad about youEmbed

songs.lyrics:
The christmas song LyricsChestnuts roasting on an open fire
Jack Frost nipping on your nose
Yuletide carols being sung by a choir
And folks dressed up like Eskimos

Everybody knows a turkey and some mistletoe
Help to make the season bright
Tiny tots with their eyes all aglow
Will find it hard to sleep tonight

They know that Santa's on his way;
He's loaded lots of toys and goodies on his sleigh
And every mother's child is going to spy
To see if reindeer really know how to fly

And so I'm offering this simple phrase
To kids from one to ninety-two
Although it's been said many times, many ways
A very Merry Christmas to youEmbed

Watch Your Step (Live) Lyrics[Verse 1]
I know the kind of pain you offer, baby
Darlin', I've felt your kind of pain before, yes I have
Change your mind
Like revolving doors, yes you do
Change your women
Like you change your clothes

[Chorus]
I just keep on telling you that
You better watch your step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
Baby listen, you better watch your step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day

[Verse 2]
Baby, I won't just forget this, baby
Don't know why you do the stuff you do, baby
Break my heart and disregard my feelings
Breaking hearts is  some kind of game to you
[Chorus]
I just keep on telling you that
You better watch your step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
Baby listen, you better watch your step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
Listen

[Bridge]
It's so easy to tease me
It's so easy to let me down, oh baby
It's so easy to mislead me, baby
It's so easy to leave me hanging around, ah
Nowhere to come down

[Saxophone solo]

[Verse 3]
Maybe we should just forget this
Oh, my baby, just throw me out of your mind
I won't stay
Not while you mistreat me
I won't stay
It's just, it's just a waste of my time
A waste of my time
[Chorus]
You better watch your step (Baby)
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
(You better stop it, baby)
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
(Just treat me good, I love it, baby)
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
[Bridge]
Leave, ha, hey, leave
Just leave, hey hey, leave
Just leave, hey, leave
Why don't you go, hey hey, go
Leave me alone, oh baby
Leave me alone, oh my
Oh my baby, oh
Oh ha ha, hey hey baby, ah ah
Ah ah ah, oh oh oh
Can't stand it when you do that, makes me crazy
When you do that, huh, makes me crazy
Makes me feel that, oh, what I feel
You don't know, oh oh oh, how I feel when you do that
What I feel, hey hey baby, woo

[Chorus]
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one day
You better watch step
You'll fall and hurt yourself one dayEmbed
